title: Sacred Visit to Tashilhunpo Monastery
description: Join a respectful visit to a traditional Tibetan monastery. Learn proper etiquette, religious vocabulary, and engage in meaningful dialogue with Lama Tenzin about Buddhist teachings and monastic life.
storyContext: You are visiting the ancient Tashilhunpo Monastery in Shigatse. As you enter the sacred grounds, you must observe proper conduct and speak respectfully. Lama Tenzin, a senior monk, has graciously agreed to answer your questions about Buddhism, meditation, and the daily life of monks. This is a rare opportunity to learn both language and wisdom.

options: It is a pleasure that you have come to this monastery.
Do you have faith in Buddhism?
I want to become a monk
I want to study Buddhist texts
I want to learn meditation practice
What do the monks do daily?
We eat breakfast in the morning
We study texts in the morning
We make offerings in the morning

One must meditate on great compassion

skillsLearned: Respectful and honorific language for religious settings
Asking meaningful questions about spiritual practice
Understanding monastic daily routines and practices
topicsIntroduced: Sacred objects: སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་འདྲ (Buddha statues), ཆོས་ཀྱི་འཁོར་ལོ (Dharma wheel)
culturalNotes: Proper etiquette includes removing hats, speaking softly, and showing deep respect
Monks are addressed with honorific language and formal titles
Buddhist philosophical discussions require specific terminology
Monastery visits often include circumambulation and offering ceremonies
Questions about suffering, compassion, and liberation are central to Buddhist dialogue
monasteryEtiquette: Always bow respectfully when meeting a Lama
Speak in hushed, reverent tones within temple halls
Ask permission before touching or photographing sacred objects
Offer gratitude for teachings and guidance received
Show genuine interest in spiritual learning, not mere curiosity
